doc.field: The Early 20th century Brooklyn postcard collection is comprised of 63 picture and photographic postcards, dating from circa 1900 to 1949, depicting various scenes in Brooklyn. The postcards are both in color and black-and-white. Some of the postcards retain their original postage stamps and include correspondence from the sender. Images of bridges, schools, churches, houses, monuments, hotels, and Prospect Park, among others, are included.

The Early 20th century Brooklyn postcard collection is comprised of 63 picture and photographic postcards, dating from circa 1900 to 1949, depicting various scenes in Brooklyn. The postcards are both in color and black-and-white. Some of the postcards retain their original postage stamps and include correspondence from the sender. Images of bridges, schools, churches, houses, monuments, hotels, and Prospect Park, among others, are included.

The Early 20th century Brooklyn postcard collection is comprised of 63 picture and photographic postcards, dating from circa 1900 to 1949, depicting various scenes in Brooklyn. The postcards are both in color and black-and-white. Some of the postcards retain their original postage stamps and include correspondence from the sender. Images of bridges, schools, churches, houses, monuments, hotels, and Prospect Park, among others, are included.
The collection was purchased by the Brooklyn Historical Society, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1988.
